maml:description.maml:para: Convert a schema.mof
Convert a schema.mof to a structured object.
The path to the schema MOF file to convert.
The path to the schema MOF file to convert.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> $MofPath = Get-SchemaMofPath -Name xhotfix -Module xWindowsUpdate PS C:\> $mof = Convert-Mof $MofPath PS C:\> $mof
Name FriendlyName Properties ---- ------------ ---------- MSFT_xWindowsUpdate xHotfix {@{DSCType=Key; PropertyType=String; PropertyN…

dev:remarks.maml:para: Warnings about failure to find a READ property are not unexpected.

maml:description.maml:para: Convert schema.mof properties to a class
Convert schema.mof properties to a class
Specify the path to the Schema.mof file.
Specify the path to the Schema.mof file.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> $MofPath = Get-SchemaMofPath -Name xhotfix -Module xWindowsUpdate PS C:\> Convert-SchemaMofProperty -Path $mofPath
Name Value ---- ----- ClassName MSFT_xWindowsUpdate Properties {[DscProperty(Key)], # Specifies the path that contains the msu file for the hotfix ins

maml:description.maml:para: Convert variable references
Convert variable references to $this.<name> to support class methods. This function is used internally by New-DSCClassDefinition, you shouldn't need to run it directly.
Enter the variable name without the $ like Path
What is the code block to be updated.
What is the code block to be updated.
Enter the variable name without the $ like Path

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> $resource = Get-DscResource -Name xHotFix -Module xWindowsUpdate PS C:\> $setFun = Get-DSCResourceFunction -Path $resource.path -Name Set-TargetResource PS C:\> $method = $setFun.Body PS C:\> foreach ($prop in $resource.properties) { $method = Convert-VariableReference -VariableName $prop.name -CodeBlock $method} PS C:\> $method Set-StrictMode -Version latest
if (!$this.Log) { $this.Log = [IO.Path]::GetTempFileName() $this.Log += '.etl'
Write-Verbose "$($LocalizedData.LogNotSpecified -f $this.{Log})" }
$uri, $kbId = Test-StandardArguments -Path $this.Path -Id $this.Id ...

maml:description.maml:para: Get the AST of PowerShell file
This command will return the AST of a PowerShell file. It is useful for debugging and understanding the structure of PowerShell scripts.
The path to the PowerShell script file.
The path to the PowerShell script file.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> $resource = Get-DscResource -Name xHotfix -Module xWindowsUpdate PS C:\> $ast = Get-AST -Path $resource.Path

maml:description.maml:para: Export the script block from a DSC Resource function.
Export the script block from a DSC Resource function.
.psm1 file with defined functions.
Specify a function by name.
Specify a function by name.
.psm1 file with defined functions.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> $resource = Get-DscResource -Name xHotfix -Module xWindowsUpdate PS C:\> Get-DSCHelperFunction -Path $resource.path -Name Get-TargetResource function Get-TargetResource { [CmdletBinding()] [OutputType([System.Collections.Hashtable])] Param ( [parameter(Mandatory = $true)] [System.String] $Path,
[parameter(Mandatory = $true)] [System.String] $Id ) Set-StrictMode -Version latest
$uri, $kbId = Test-StandardArguments -Path $Path -Id $Id
Write-Verbose $($LocalizedData.GettingHotfixMessage -f ${Id})
$hotfix = Get-HotFix -Id "KB$kbId"
$returnValue = @{ Path = '' Id = $hotfix.HotFixId Log = '' }
$returnValue
}

maml:description.maml:para: Export the Get/Set/Test script block from a DSC Resource function
Export the Get/Set/Test script block from a DSC Resource function
Specify the .ps1 or .psm1 file with defined functions.
Specify a function by name.
Specify a function by name.
Specify the .ps1 or .psm1 file with defined functions.
Get function names
This command uses the AST to retrieve function names from a PowerShell script file.
Specify the .ps1 or .psm1 file with defined functions.
List all detected function names.
Write a rich detailed object to the pipeline.
List all detected function names.
Write a rich detailed object to the pipeline.
Specify the .ps1 or .psm1 file with defined functions.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> $resource = Get-DscResource -Name xHotfix -Module xWindowsUpdate PS C:\> Get-FunctionName $resource.path Get-TargetResource Trace-Message New-InvalidArgumentException Set-TargetResource Test-TargetResource Test-StandardArguments Test-WindowsUpdatePath

maml:description.maml:para: Get the schema MOF path
Use this command to retrieve the the schema MOF path for a DSC resource. The path is the location of the schema.mof file for the specified DSC resource.
Enter the DSC Resource name
Enter the DSC module name for the resource
Get the contents of the file instead of only the path.
Get the contents of the file instead of only the path.
Enter the DSC module name for the resource
Enter the DSC Resource name

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Get-SchemaMofPath -Name xhotfix -Module xWindowsUpdate C:\Program Files\WindowsPowerShell\Modules\xWindowsUpdate\2.8.0.0\DscResources\MSFT_xWindowsUpdate\MSFT_xWindowsUpdate.schema.mof

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 2 --------------------------

maml:description.maml:para: Get MOF schema keys
This command will process a schema MOF file and return information about different key types. This is used internally in Convert-Mof
Full path to the schema mof file
Specify the MOF property type
Full path to the schema mof file
Specify the MOF property type

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------

maml:description.maml:para: Convert a DSC resource to a class definition
Convert a DSC resource to a class-based definition. The output is the new definition. You can pipe output to a file or the clipboard.
Enter the DSC Resource name
Enter the DSC module name for the resource
Enter the DSC module name for the resource
Enter the DSC Resource name

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> New-DSCClassDefinition -Name xhotfix -Module xWindowsUpdate | Set-Clipboard

dev:remarks.maml:para: Create a class definition for the xHotfix resource and copy the output to the clipboard.

maml:description.maml:para: Create DSC enums
Create enums from the value map in schema.mof files
Specify the path to the Schema.mof file.
Specify the path to the Schema.mof file.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------

maml:description.maml:para: Open the DSCResourceMigration location

This is a simple command that will change location to the root of the DSCResource Migration module. The command will list the available demonstration scripts. You can review the project's README file and code samples.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> Open-DSCResourceMigration
Directory: C:\Program Files\PowerShell\Modules\DSCResourceMigration
Mode LastWriteTime Length Name ---- ------------- ------ ---- -a--- 4/16/2025 3:51 PM 1388 Demo-MigrateResource.ps1 -a--- 4/16/2025 6:46 PM 6269 Migrate-Module.ps1 -a--- 4/16/2025 6:46 PM 4809 Migrate.ps1
